Role: Technical Business Analyst
Client Location: Austin/Houston/Dallas, Texas (Remote)
Job Family: Development
Job: Technical Lead
Don't share without certification resumes & Need Technical BA
Note: Certification in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA).
Skill (Primary): Microsoft Dynamics (APPS)-MsD-General-Technical-Business Analysis

Job Description: Technical Business Analyst (TBA) The Technical Business Analyst (TBA) will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions in ServiceNow. This individual will be responsible for analyzing business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring that the delivered solution aligns with the overall business objectives.

Responsibilities:
Business Analysis: Gather, analyze, and document business requirements, including process flows, use cases, and data models. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their needs and priorities. Develop and maintain business process documentation.

Analytical Skills: Utilize data analysis techniques to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. Develop and maintain data dictionaries and data quality standards.

Application Development: Work closely with development teams to ensure that technical solutions align with business requirements. Provide technical guidance and support throughout the development lifecycle.

CSDM Experience: Possess a deep understanding of the Common Services Data Model (CSDM) and its application in enterprise data management. Contribute to the design and implementation of CSDM-based data solutions.

Playbook Runbook Development: Create detailed playbooks and runbooks to guide operational activities and incident response. Ensure that playbooks and runbooks are well-documented and easy to follow.

Architectural Diagrams: Develop and maintain architectural diagrams, including system, data, and network diagrams. Communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in data modeling and database management tools. Strong understanding of software development methodologies and tools. Familiarity with business process modeling and analysis techniques. Knowledge of cloud computing platforms and technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

Preferred Qualifications: Certification in business analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA). Experience with Agile development methodologies. Knowledge of specific industry standards or regulations.
